p: In this study, antimicrobial activity of the extracts was identified by determining the minimum inhibitory concentrations (MICs). A concentration range of 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 63, 125, 250, 500 µg.mL −1 was established against each microorganism and MIC values identified for each microorganism were given in Table 1. According to the results all MIC values of the extracts against three strains were ≥ 125 µg.mL −1.
